abstract: With no prototype, the Cingular board’s approval of the partnership was an act of blind trust.
snippet: With no prototype, the Cingular board’s approval of the partnership was an act of blind trust.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 — When Cingular executives went to the company’s board last year to get approval for a deal with Apple, they did so without so much as a prototype of an Apple phone to show the directors. The board signed off anyway.

headline.main: In Cingular-Apple Deal, Only Phone Was Missing
headline.print_headline: In Cingular-Apple Deal, Only a Phone Was Missing

abstract: Apple chose the name iPhone even though Cisco Systems had recently introduced a Wi-Fi-based phone with the same name.
snippet: Apple chose the name iPhone even though Cisco Systems had recently introduced a Wi-Fi-based phone with the same name.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 — With characteristic showmanship, Steven P. Jobs introduced Apple’s long-awaited entry into the cellphone world Tuesday, pronouncing it an achievement on a par with the Macintosh and the iPod.

headline.print_headline: Apple, Hoping for Another iPod, Introduces Innovative Cellphone

abstract: Steve Jobs has granted the wishes of Apple followers by turning the ordinary cellphone into the iPhone.
snippet: Steve Jobs has granted the wishes of Apple followers by turning the ordinary cellphone into the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 - Remember the fairy godmother in “Cinderella”? She’d wave her wand and turn some homely and utilitarian object, like a pumpkin or a mouse, into something glamorous and amazing, like a carriage or fully accessorized coachman.

abstract: The Apple cellphone is getting all the attention, but the company also announced a TV that connects to the Internet.
snippet: The Apple cellphone is getting all the attention, but the company also announced a TV that connects to the Internet.
lead_paragraph: The Apple cellphone is getting all the attention, but the company also announced a device that connects your TV to the Internet.

abstract: Apple doesn’t have a booth at CES and it clearly doesn’t need one. The iPhone announcement seems to have overshadowed most of what’s going on in Las Vegas.
snippet: Apple doesn’t have a booth at CES and it clearly doesn’t need one. The iPhone announcement seems to have overshadowed most of what’s going on in Las Vegas.
lead_paragraph: Steve Jobs said yesterday that he hopes Apple’s new iPhone will eventually garner one percent of the world-wide market. Judging by readers’ comments, enthusiastic commentary on Good Morning America, and a constant discussion of the phone’s features in the Consumer Electronics Show pressroom, he may very well meet that goal.
